20051122

I pasted some code into a java editor and got the following exception continually until I changed the focus


!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.jobs 4 2 2005-11-24 13:27:46.609
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Requesting Java AST from selection".
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.javaeditor.JavaEditor.updateOccurrenceAnnotations(JavaEditor.java:2917)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.javaeditor.JavaEditor$6.selectionChanged(JavaEditor.java:2932)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.viewsupport.SelectionListenerWithASTManager$PartListenerGroup.calculateASTandInform(SelectionListenerWithASTManager.java:173)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.viewsupport.SelectionListenerWithASTManager$3.run(SelectionListenerWithASTManager.java:142)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

I haven't found an easy way to replicate but I will post it when I can
Did pasting the same code not bring the problem back?
No - I did some clicking around to get out of the situation but that got me back into a consistent state

Looks like once of the occurrence updater adds a null-node or the AST is corrupted. Without a test case this is hard to fix. We don't want to add a null-ceck at the error location because this would hide the problem.

Tod, did you check the .log?
The log is where I got this trace from.
OK, let's rephrase my question: was there some other entry near this one?
Sorry Dani - I didn't see one as the .log was full of these errors.
*** Bug 118904 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 119094 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Next time you see this please do the following:
- don't move the caret and create a screenshot that contains the caret
- attach the screenshot to this bug
- click into the editor but make sure not to click inside some word/text
- copy the content and attach it here
Finaly got it myself and can now debug and fix.

Found the bug: MethodExitFinder has trouble if the caret is near a return inside a constructor.

Fixed in HEAD.
Available in builds > 20051208-0010.
